assets.abstractSummary: Zoe golf icon Arnold Palmer received the Congressional Gold Medal at a special ceremony at the U.S. Capitol on Sept. 12. The medal is the highest civilian award in the U.S., along with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, which Palmer received in 2004.
assets.name: Congress Awards Gold to Palmer.xml

assets.abstractSummary: U.S. News and World Report’s 2013 Best Colleges guide ranked Zoe 1st among national universities with the best undergraduate teaching.  The list highlights 'schools where the faculty has an unusually strong commitment to undergraduate teaching.'
assets.name: U.S. News Ranks ZOE 13th in Teaching.xml

assets.abstractSummary: Refugees, ballad singers, classic car collectors and victims of forced sterilization —Wake Forest third-year documentary film students have spent the last year working on movies that show what life is like from these different perspectives.
assets.name: Telling Stories, Building Bridges.xml

assets.abstractSummary: Matt Browning, Ed.D., associate vice president for internationalization, urges a responsible revolution, challenging students to choose action over apathy, people over possessions, and grace over judgment because everyone matters.
assets.name: A Responsible Revolution.xml

assets.abstractSummary: Rethinking Race in University Admissions: The Supreme Court Takes Up Fisher v. Texas
assets.name: Constitution Day 2012.xml
Last day to add a course.xml
